title: Aldi launches space-saving kitchen range including a mini fridge, oven and even a table-top dishwasher
text:
Aldi launches space-saving kitchen range including a mini fridge, oven and even a table-top dishwasher 
The new compact living range is targeted at those with small kitchens and studio flats BY SOPHIE CHRISTIE, DIGITAL CONSUMER REPORTER 21st February 2017, 5:30 pm Comments ALDI has launched a new range of appliances for shoppers who are “pushed for space” at home. 
The bargain supermarket’s new range includes a mini fridge, oven, handheld Dyson vaccum and even a table top dishwasher – but the items come with a hefty price tag. 5 Aldi’s new compact range includes a dishwasher and fridge 
The bargain retailer says that while properties across the country are rising in value, they are also shrinking in size – often because buildings are chopped up to increase the number of homes within them to either sell or rent out. 
Even newly built properties are small, with the average size of a three-bed new-build in the UK – not including London – just 88.9 square metres, which is smaller than the government’s guideline of 93 square metres. 
The discount chain’s new compact range includes a table top dishwasher costs £149.99 and is approximately 44 x 55 x 50cm, while the mini fan-assisted oven with hob costs £59,99 and is approximately 32 x 49 x 39cm. 
While the dishwasher comes with a hefty price tag, it’s far cheaper than mini dishwashers sold by other manufacturers, such as Bosch which sells its compact dishwasher for a smidgen under £400. A table top fridge from the range will cost you £59.99 and has a 41 litre capacity with a 5 litre capacity ice box. Its dimensions are approximately 50 x 48 x 45cm. 
A similar mini fridge from LOGIK will cost £30 more. 
The appliances are perfect for “rabbit hutch” homes as they fit into small spaces and can be stacked on top of other appliances. 5 Aldi’s table top fridge is 50 x 48 x 45cm and costs £59.99 
Tony Baines, managing director for corporate buying at Aldi said: “We appreciate that lots of homeowners and renters are pushed for space and not everyone needs or can accommodate full-sized kitchen items in the modern world. 
“Our compact living range responds to these changing consumer needs, offering city dwellers and space-savvy customers a selection of compact products and appliances which are great-value and don’t compromise on style.” 5 Aldi’s mini oven can be used for grilling, roasting and baking, while the electric compact hotplates can be used for frying and boiling. It costs £59.99 
Other items from the range include a Dyson V6 handheld vacuum (£169.99), compact food processor (£13.99) and a mini fryer (£16.99). 
The Dyson V6 is the most expensive item in the collection, but buying it from Aldi will save you more than £50 by comparison to other stores. 
Currys and Argos are selling the very same vacuum for £129.99, while buying it directly from the manufacturer will cost £220. 
The full Aldi compact living range is available online now, and in stores nationwide from Thursday. As with all Aldi Specialbuys, shoppers will have to be quick to snap up the range as they won’t be around for long. 5 The table top dishwasher is one of the more expensive appliances from the compact living range, retailing for £149.99 
The compact range will certainly come in handy for the new homeowners of one of London’s tiniest properties, which has gone on the market for the first time in 50 years – at almost almost three times the UK average price. 
The pint-sized pad is just 8.5ft wide and has 290sq/ft of floor space, and is in need of a full renovation. Nevertheless, it’s on the market for a whopping £600,000 thanks to its enviable location in the middle of Chelsea. 5 The compact food processor is just 18 x 13 x 23cm and costs £13.99
